Tired after a long day's work, I absentmindedly raise the cup to my mouth and drain it in one big swallow. I sigh with relief, savoring this one carefree moment. Then I notice the bitter aftertaste on my tongue...

It only takes me a moment to find it – on the tray from which I grabbed the cup is a sealed letter. I know that symbol. With shaking hands, I tear it open. "This is not your last day, [Root.GetFirstName]. Our patience, however, is not endless. We will claim that which we are owed. The money or your life – that is up to you."
I cannot risk the fury of [Root.Society.GetName].

[assassins_recruiter.GetFirstName], you sound like a mindless follower of False Triarchy!

Continue in your attempt to recruit §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! to [Root.Society.GetName].

Since I had such a good time a few weeks back, I invited [assassins_recruiter.GetTitledFirstName] to share an informal meal. Yet again the conversation found its way to the topic of religion and righteousness. [assassins_recruiter.GetSheHeCap] expressed [assassins_recruiter.GetHerHis] admiration for those willing to give their life fighting for their beliefs.

As I praised those willing to die for their faith, [From.GetFirstName] agreed wholeheartedly, wishing [From.GetSheHe] could be more like them.

I was just about to draft an invitation when [From.GetTitledFirstName] invited you to dine with [From.GetHerHim]. The conversation flowed easily and [From.GetFirstName] expressed many admirable sentiments. However, when I mentioned those willing to die for their beliefs, [From.GetSheHe] sneered and condemned "such fanatics".
I think the time has come to ask the question.
Invite §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! to join [Root.Society.GetName].
Although I fear [From.GetFirstName] is unwilling to fight, [From.GetHerselfHimself].
Fanatics? [From.GetFirstName] is blind to the righteousness of our ways!

We are quiet for a moment, both seemingly contemplating these devoted souls. Then [From.GetFirstName] looks up at me, a curious intensity in [From.GetHerHis] gaze. "That is not an impossible wish, [Root.GetFirstName]. Are you ready to kill and, if She wills it, get killed to defend the words of Her Prophet and the Triarchy?"
I am, [From.GetFirstName]. And you say there is a way?
Ask §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]§! what you can do to serve a greater cause.
What nonsense are you speaking, [From.GetFirstName]?
Dismiss §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! question and end the dinner.

When I suggested there is a way for [From.GetTitledFirstName] to serve the greater good, [From.GetSheHe] only scoffed dismissively and changed the subject. Judging by the look [From.GetSheHe] gave me as I left, however, it seems as if [From.GetFirstName] is not so oblivious after all...
[From.GetSheHeCap] is all grand words but lacks true courage. Disappointing.

When I suggested there is a way for [From.GetTitledFirstName] to serve the greater good, [From.GetHerHis] eyes lit up with a glimmer of hope. "I am ready, [Root.GetFirstName]. Please, if it is true, will you set me on this path?"
Someone will get in touch with you shortly, [From.GetFirstName].
Write a letter to the order about §Y[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! induction. [assassins_inductor.GetSocietyRank] §Y[assassins_inductor.GetFirstName]§! will handle it from here.

I do, [Root.GetFirstName], says [From.GetTitledFirstName] with a solemn, almost ceremonial, voice. "There is an Order devoted to Reanna and the rightful Triarchy. One that defends those true of faith and bring vengeance to their persecutors. [Root.Society.GetName] are always in need of champions. Think it over, and someone might reach out..."
Me, an Assassin? Perhaps this is my destiny...
Think things over while you wait for someone to get in touch.

My eyes open, seeing only darkness. For a moment, my mind is blank, before the first thoughts get through the haze of sleep. Why did I wake up? A deep [Root.GetManWoman]'s voice cuts through the silence, startling me. "The time has come for you to profess your devoutness to Reanna and the Triarchy."
Navruz guide me! Glory to Triarchy!
Declare your devoutness to the Triarchy.
I will shout their names from the rooftops! Glory to Triarchy!
Openly convert to the Church of Triarchy.\n
I will carry out Reanna's wishes in secret, no matter the risk.
Secretly convert to the Church of Triarchy. You may openly covert at a later time.\n
I... I'm not sure I have what it takes.
Do not declare your devoutness.

Excellent. I turn my head towards the voice. A hooded figure steps out of the shadows by the [Root.GetChamberOpening] and a hand appears from underneath the cloak, holding out a piece of parchment. "Before we continue, you must sign this. A written pledge of allegiance to the Grand Master of [Root.Society.GetName]. A routine... safety measure."
Of course. One moment, let me find a quill...
Sign the pledge of allegiance.
But this could be used against me!
Refuse to sign the pledge of allegiance.

As soon as I lift the tip of the quill from the parchment the hooded [Root.GetManWoman] snatches it from the desk. "The Grand Master will be pleased, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. You will receive an invitation to our stronghold, but for now, go back to bed. You will need the rest." The next moment, [Root.GetSheHe] is gone.
Farewell... I suppose.
Now all you can do is wait.

Three Blessings, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
You are hereby invited to [Root.Society.GetName] stronghold in [inductor_rendezvous.County.GetName]. Arrive at the [inductor_rendezvous.GetHolding] of [inductor_rendezvous.GetName] in a fortnight's time. One of our people will collect you there. As I finally arrive at the castle, my guide brings me to the main tower, where I am introduced to [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName].
I am ready to serve, [From.GetSocietyRank].

There is no time for pleasantries, not even a moment to catch my breath, before [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] leads me through another door, down a spiraling stone staircase. We descend in silence. The stair ends and the [From.GetSocietyRank] opens another door, revealing a gloomy basement room and a figure kneeling on the floor.

This, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] says solemnly as I enter, "is your test". With these words, [From.GetSheHe] pulls the hood from the [assassins_sacrifice.GetManWoman]'s head. It is [assassins_sacrifice.GetTitledFirstName], my [assassins_sacrifice.GetRootRelation]! The shock in [assassins_sacrifice.GetHerHis] eyes must be mirroring my own. I turn around and run. [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]'s footsteps get closer behind me and as I reach the top of the stairs, [From.GetSheHe] grips a fistful of my mantle, pulling you down on top of [From.GetHerHis]. Vertigo. Crippling pain. Blind, manic frenzy. By some miracle, you manage to free yourself. You are alive. But for how much longer?

There is no time to think. As I accept the dagger from [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName] I stab at [From.GetHerHim], without a moment's hesitation. The blade strikes only air. [From.GetSheHeCap] moves too quickly. I am on the floor, trapped under the weight of [From.GetHerHis] body. I plead for my life as [From.GetSheHe] wrestles the weapon from my hand.
I... I panicked! Please! You... you have to believe me!

The look on [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]'s face is pure disappointment. "We had high hopes for you, [Root.GetFirstName], although it seems we were mistaken." I swallow. Loudly. "This cowardice makes you useless to us. Your gold, on the other hand..." As I leave, my intended victim in tow, my hands will not stop shaking.
You... you have my gratitude.

You have no idea what happened as you wake up on the floor of your [Root.GetChamber], a taste of blood in your mouth and a pounding ache along the side of your face. Slowly, the memories come back. A hooded [Root.GetManWoman]... [Root.Society.GetName]. Perhaps you should consider yourself lucky, getting away with only a black eye.

There is a solemn, almost reverential, atmosphere as the crowd pours out of the [Root.GetHouseOfWorship] after the [Root.GetReligiousRite]. I follow the flow of people absentmindedly while I ponder what the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] said regarding right and wrong, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] and [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]. Suddenly, I stumble. A moment later something heavy pushes me down into the dirt.

As the cell door creaks I steady myself. [Host.GetTitledFirstName]'s jailer is a brute of a [Host.GetManWoman].
